section: *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal
explanation: The description lacks clarity and precision. It's unclear what specific technical aspects are included, the exact nature of the database, and the level of expertise required from the assigned employees. The phrase 'medical dispatch personal & product service as needed' is vague and could be interpreted in multiple ways. The ambiguous language makes it difficult to enforce specific obligations regarding BorrowMoney.com, inc.'s responsibilities.

section: Duties of Members may be amended, from time to time, by decision of the Members, provided that the Members' interests are not affected except with the unanimous consent of the Members.
explanation: This section allows for amendment of member duties by a simple 'decision of the members' if the member's interests aren't affected, but requires unanimous consent if they are. This is an in-text contradiction. What is a 'decision of the members', is that the same as a Majority vote, or does it require both members to agree on the decision?

section: Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: This section includes two different descriptions, one of property (office space) and one of monthly revenue from awarded contracts. This is an in-text contradiction because the value of the office space is set to $3,500,000.00 USD and the value of the revenue awarded is also set to $3,500,000.00 USD. The value is not equivalent to both contributions.

section: Any vote required by the Members will be determined such that each Member receives one vote, however, BorrowMoney.com, inc.'s vote will carry twice the weight of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's vote.
explanation: This section contradicts the general principle of equal voting rights among members in a joint venture. While it's not illegal to weight votes differently, it introduces a structural imbalance that could be seen as unfair or inequitable. This could lead to disputes and undermine the collaborative nature of the joint venture. One member's vote carries more weight than the other which can lead to disagreements down the road.

section: This Agreement may be amended with the consent of BorrowMoney.com, inc., notwithstanding any objection from JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go.
explanation: This clause gives BorrowMoney.com, inc. unilateral power to amend the agreement, regardless of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's objections. This creates a significant power imbalance and undermines the mutual nature of the agreement. It contradicts the principle of joint decision-making and could be deemed unconscionable or unenforceable. The other member does not have a say on the agreement when it comes to amendments.

section: Dissociation of a Member 31. Where a Member is in breach of this Agreement and that Member has not remedied the breach on notice from the Venture and after a reasonable period then the remaining Members will have the right to terminate this Agreement with regard to that individual defaulting Member (an "Involuntary Withdrawal") and take whatever action necessary to protect the interests of the Venture. 32. If the Venture is harmed as the result of an individual Member's action or failure to act, then that individual Member will be liable for that harm. If more than one Member is at fault then they will be jointly and severally liable for that harm.
explanation: Section 31 discusses breach of contract and Section 32 discusses the Venture being harmed by a members action. If more than one member is at fault then they will be jointly and severally liable for that harm. But if there is a breach of contract by a single member, that member will only be reliable for the harm, and not jointly, creating an in-text contadiction.
